textResponse: As an Autumn starter, you must pay at least one third of your fee amount before 31 October. Failure to meet this deadline may result in being prevented from enrolling or accessing academic services.

When to pay your fees
When to pay your tuition fees

Autumn starters must pay at least one third of your fee amount before 31 October, or you may be prevented from enrolling or accessing academic services.

sources.title: www_ucl.ac.uk-studentsfeespay-your-feeswhen-to-pay.html
sources.docSource: URL link uploaded by the user.
sources.text:
<document_metadata>
sourceDocument: www_ucl.ac.uk-studentsfeespay-your-feeswhen-to-pay.html
published: 7/7/2024, 6:59:25 PM
</document_metadata>

If you are self-funding all or part of your studies you must ensure that you pay your fees by the deadlines indicated below. For most full and part-time students who are self-funded and enrolling in autumn, payments can be made in three instalments:

Instalment
	
Deadline
	
Amount



1

	

31 October

	one third


2

	

7 February

	

one third


3	2 May (extended to 14 May)	

one third (this is the remaining balance)

You will not receive an invoice for your fees but you may view what you owe within Portico. It’s your responsibility to make sure they are paid. You can make as many payments as you like, or from multiple cards, as long as the required amount is paid by the deadline.

Instalment deadlines for Modular students\xa0enrolling in\xa0autumn

sources.title: www_ucl.ac.uk-studentsfeespay-your-feeswhen-to-pay.html
sources.docSource: URL link uploaded by the user.
sources.text:
<document_metadata>
sourceDocument: www_ucl.ac.uk-studentsfeespay-your-feeswhen-to-pay.html
published: 7/7/2024, 6:59:25 PM
</document_metadata>

Students enrolling in the new calendar year (i.e. January to April) will not be entitled to TLE and will be expected to pay at least 50% of their fee liability (charged from your start date until the end of the academic year) or provide proof of sponsorship to be fully enrolled. The second instalment is due by 2nd May. Any students enrolling in May or later in the academic year are expected to pay 100% of the fee due or provide proof of sponsorship for this period. You will not be entitled to TLE.

All information relating to the cost of your programme can be found on the published Fee Schedules or your Portico account.

\xa0Fee liability for interrupting and withdrawing students

sources.title: www_ucl.ac.uk-studentsfeespay-your-feeswhen-to-pay.html
sources.docSource: URL link uploaded by the user.
sources.text:
<document_metadata>
sourceDocument: www_ucl.ac.uk-studentsfeespay-your-feeswhen-to-pay.html
published: 7/7/2024, 6:59:25 PM
</document_metadata>

If you are enrolling at the beginning of the academic year in autumn and do not pay your first instalment, or provide evidence of sponsorship before or during enrolment, you will be given ‘Time Limited Enrolment’ (TLE) status. This expires on 31st October each year and it is essential that you pay one third of your fee liability, or provide evidence of sponsorship, by this date. Once either of these criteria have been met, your status will be updated to ‘Enrolled’. Failure to meet these criteria by this date will result in application of a debt flag on your account and loss of services/facilities (known as Academic Sanctions).
